title: Wallsend stabbing: Newborn baby dies after knife attack that left mum injured
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

A three-week-old baby boy who was stabbed at at a house last week has died in hospital.

The tot and his mum were both left with life-threatening injuries following a stabbing at their home in Wallsend, Newcastle, on Wednesday.

Emergency services arrived at the scene at around 2.15pm and arrested a man on suspicion of attempted murder.

Both the 21-year-old mum and her young child were said to have suffered injuries from a "bladed article".

The three-week-old boy has now died, police today confirmed.

The woman continues to receive hospital care and is now in a stable condition.

(Image: chroniclelive.co.uk/)

A baby on a stretcher and a woman wrapped in blankets were seen being taken away by air ambulance in the minutes after the attack.

Detective Chief Inspector Dave Cole, of Northumbria Police, said: “This is a devastating time for the baby's family.

"Specialist officers continue to offer them support and I know the community in Wallsend are by their side too.

“It is impossible to imagine what they are going through and I would ask the public to continue to respect the family’s privacy at this time.

(Image: chroniclelive.co.uk/)

“A man has been charged in relation to the incident and we will continue to work closely with the Crown Prosecution Service as the case moves forward.”

Denis Erdinch Beytula, 27, of Wallsend, has been charged with two counts of attempted murder.

He appeared in North Tyneside Magistrates’ Court last Thursday where he was remanded in custody and will appear at Newcastle Crown Court at a future date.
description: Denis Erdinch Beytula has been charged with two counts of attempted murder and has been remanded in custody
